alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 11:56PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest Ohio, including the following county, in Southwest Ohio, Butler. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1156 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hamilton, Fairfield, Sharonville, Monroe, Springdale, West Chester, Ross, Olde West Chester, Wetherington, Dunlap, Four Bridges, New Miami, Millville, Maustown, Pleasant Run Farm, Beckett Ridge, Pleasant Run, Hughes, Maud and Pisgah.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
